title: behaviour_trees
content:
前言

本文主要介绍基于ros-noetic 版本的行为树

https://github.com/splintered-reality/py_trees_ros/blob/devel/README.md

在规划复杂机器人行为中，行为树可以很好地帮我们完成行为的规划，与传统的有限状态机对比

采用行为树具有以下优势：

1、灵活：行为树允许在行为之间建立更丰富的关系，并且允许在更高级别的层次上组织这些行为，使得系统行为更加灵活。相比之下，有限状态机只能描述状态之间的简单转换关系，不太适合描述复杂的行为。

2、易于扩展和修改：行为树的分层结构使得修改和扩展系统的行为更加容易。在行为树中添加或删除一个节点，只需要对相应的层次进行修改，而不需要修改整个系统的状态转换图。这样可以提高开发的效率和可靠性。

3、可视化：行为树可以以图形化的方式呈现，使得系统的行为可以更加直观地理解和管理。相比之下，有限状态机通常需要绘制状态转换图，不太直观。

4、具有多种行为模式：行为树允许节点之间有队列，并行，选择，装饰器等多种行为，可以更好地描述系统的复杂行为。相比之下，有限状态机只支持简单的状态转换，难以描述复杂的条件和并行行为。

行为树具有以下特征

  • 以root节点开始执行，直到达到最终状态
  • 每个节点都是可以执行的行为，每个行为都会在执行中返回他的状态(success, failure, or running)
  • 内部节点也能控制遍历，树的内部节点将接受其子节点的结果状态，并应用自己的规则来指示接下来应扩展哪个节点。

行为树的组件

行为树有以下组件，这些组件决定了下面的子行为返回状态后该执行哪一个行为

  • Sequence: 按照顺序执行每一个行为（前提是前一个行为返回成功），如果前一个行为返回失败，则整个sequence返回失败
  • Selector: select 下的子行为按照优先级排序，按顺序执行，直到一个行为返回成功或者失败，作为根节点的状态
  • Chooser: 跟select 差不多，但是不会被中断
  • Parallel:同时执行根节点

blackboard

黑板，用于实现不同行为间的数据传输

修饰器

修饰一个行为的返回状态

如：

  • py_trees.decorators.FailureIsRunning()
  • py_trees.decorators.FailureIsSuccess()
  • py_trees.decorators.RunningIsFailure()
  • py_trees.decorators.RunningIsSuccess()
  • py_trees.decorators.SuccessIsFailure()
  • py_trees.decorators.SuccessIsRunning()

如何编写一个行为：

以下内容来自官方api文档

http://docs.ros.org/en/noetic/api/py_trees/html/behaviours.html

# doc/examples/skeleton_behaviour.py

import py_trees
import random



class Foo(py_trees.Behaviour):
    def __init__(self, name):
        """
        Minimal one-time initialisation. A good rule of thumb is
        to only include the initialisation relevant for being able
        to insert this behaviour in a tree for offline rendering to
        dot graphs.

        Other one-time initialisation requirements should be met via
        the setup() method.
        """
        super(Foo, self).__init__(name)

    def setup(self, timeout):
        """
        When is this called?
          This function should be either manually called by your program
          or indirectly called by a parent behaviour when it's own setup
          method has been called.

          If you have vital initialisation here, a useful design pattern
          is to put a guard in your initialise() function to barf the
          first time your behaviour is ticked if setup has not been
          called/succeeded.

        What to do here?
          Delayed one-time initialisation that would otherwise interfere
          with offline rendering of this behaviour in a tree to dot graph.
          Good examples include:
          - Hardware or driver initialisation
          - Middleware initialisation (e.g. ROS pubs/subs/services)
        """
        self.logger.debug("  %s [Foo::setup()]" % self.name)

    def initialise(self):
        """
        When is this called?
          The first time your behaviour is ticked and anytime the
          status is not RUNNING thereafter.

        What to do here?
          Any initialisation you need before putting your behaviour
          to work.
        """
        self.logger.debug("  %s [Foo::initialise()]" % self.name)

    def update(self):
        """
        When is this called?
          Every time your behaviour is ticked.

        What to do here?
          - Triggering, checking, monitoring. Anything...but do not block!
          - Set a feedback message
          - return a py_trees.Status.[RUNNING, SUCCESS, FAILURE]
        """
        self.logger.debug("  %s [Foo::update()]" % self.name)
        ready_to_make_a_decision = random.choice([True, False])
        decision = random.choice([True, False])
        if not ready_to_make_a_decision:
            return py_trees.Status.RUNNING
        elif decision:
            self.feedback_message = "We are not bar!"
            return py_trees.Status.SUCCESS
        else:
            self.feedback_message = "Uh oh"
            return py_trees.Status.FAILURE

    def terminate(self, new_status):
        """
        When is this called?
           Whenever your behaviour switches to a non-running state.
            - SUCCESS || FAILURE : your behaviour's work cycle has finished
            - INVALID : a higher priority branch has interrupted, or shutting down
        """
        self.logger.debug("  %s [Foo::terminate().terminate()][%s->%s]" % (self.name, self.status, new_status))

用户可以编写子类重新复写这些函数

init()函数

在创建这个行为对象时就会被执行

官方解释：

"""
        Minimal one-time initialisation. A good rule of thumb is
        to only include the initialisation relevant for being able
        to insert this behaviour in a tree for offline rendering to
        dot graphs.

        Other one-time initialisation requirements should be met via
        the setup() method.
        """

setup()函数

其作用用于第一次初始化这个行为，其实行为树把一个行为的初始化分成很多部分，第一部分为setup，第二部分为initialise()，这个setup（）函数是在进入到根节点之后执行的，无论这个根节点怎么循环，这个函数只执行一次，用官方的话来解释就是

This function should be either manually called by your programor 
indirectly called by a parent behaviour when it's own setup
method has been called.

也就是说要么自己提前初始化，要么等根节点帮你自动初始化

initialise()函数

每次轮到这个行为的运行的时候就会执行这个函数，这意味着这个函数会被执行很多此

update()函数

相当于一个while循环，当状态返回不是RUNNING的时候他会不断重复执行这个函数

terminate()函数

当行为的状态切换到不是RUNNING的状态就会被执行，或者当被更高优先级的行为打断是就会被执行，通常用来取消已启动的外部操作，或者关闭任何临时通信句柄

如何在行为之间传输数据

self.blackboard=py_trees.blackboard.Blackboard()
placed_block=self.blackboard.get("xxx")
self.blackboard.set("名",值)

实例（一个用于发布action goal的行为）

class action_behavior(py_trees.behaviour.Behaviour):

    def __init__(self,name="action client",action_goal=None,action_namespace="/move_base",override_feedback_message_on_running="moving"):
        super().__init__(name)
        self.action_client=None
        self.sent_goal=False
        self.action_goal=action_goal
        self.action_namespace=action_namespace
        self.override_feedback_message_on_running=override_feedback_message_on_running

    def setup(self,timeout):
        self.logger.debug("%s.setup()" % self.__class__.__name__)
        self.action_client=actionlib.SimpleActionClient(self.action_namespace,move_base_msgs.MoveBaseAction)
        if not self.action_client.wait_for_server(rospy.Duration(timeout)):
            self.logger.error("{0}.setup() could not connect to the action server at '{1}'".format(self.__class__.__name__, self.action_namespace))
            self.action_client = None
            return False
        return True
    def initialise(self):
        self.logger.debug("{0}.initialise()".format(self.__class__.__name__))
        self.sent_goal=False
    
    def update(self):
        if not self.action_client:
            self.feedback_message="no action,did u call setup() on your tree?"
            return py_trees.Status.INVALID
        if not self.sent_goal:
            self.action_client.send_goal(self.action_goal)
            self.sent_goal=True
            self.feedback_message="sent goal to the action server"
            return py_trees.Status.RUNNING
        self.feedback_message=self.action_client.get_goal_status_text()
        if self.action_client.get_state in  [GoalStatus.ABORTED,GoalStatus.PREEMPTED]:
            return py_trees.Status.FAILURE
        result = self.action_client.get_result()
        
        if result:

            return py_trees.Status.SUCCESS
        else:
            self.feedback_message = self.override_feedback_message_on_running
            return py_trees.Status.RUNNING
    def terminate(self, new_status):
        """
        If running and the current goal has not already succeeded, cancel it.

        Args:
            new_status (:class:`~py_trees.common.Status`): the behaviour is transitioning to this new status
        """
        self.logger.debug("%s.terminate(%s)" % (self.__class__.__name__, "%s->%s" % (self.status, new_status) if self.status != new_status else "%s" % new_status))
        if self.action_client is not None and self.sent_goal:
            motion_state = self.action_client.get_state()
            if ((motion_state == GoalStatus.PENDING) or (motion_state == GoalStatus.ACTIVE) or
               (motion_state == GoalStatus.PREEMPTING) or (motion_state == GoalStatus.RECALLING)):
                self.action_client.cancel_goal()
        self.sent_goal = False
